Well...personally I prefer AVI, or more to the point, the DivX codec, I don't really care what format as long as it's DivX'd, best compression, minimal quality loss.  That said, I'd rather download the 888MB MP4 than the 1.36GB AVI that's got 1000+ more seeds.  I have an SSD so drive space is the real premium for me.  Besides, who the fuck has a modern computer that can't play MP4?  I mean, hell, VLC will play MP4.  I use Media Player Classic (VLC with less bloat) and it plays AVI and MP4 equally well.  To me, as long as I'm not burning 1GB per movie, it could be a freaking WMV for all I care.

So...yeah, DivX would've been nice, but seriously folks, it's free.  Be glad to get what you can.

(P.S. Sorry, my comments make MUCH less sense after midnight...)

@angel2dmn , LEERV - You are morons. No one wants to have to CONVERT a video after downloading it. You want to WATCH it. Having said that, MP4 is okay... The real problem is x264 (h.264) which is NOT a standard yet. There are a dozen different encoders and not all players play the various variations (sorry, that was awkward). Hence, best to stick to XVID.
